text: James Bradford Nutter, Sr. (January 23, 1928 - July 7, 2017) was an American businessman and philanthropist. He was the founder and chairman of James B. Nutter & Company, a privately owned mortgage banking firm headquartered in Kansas City, Missouri. It is one of the oldest and largest family-owned and operated mortgage lending firms in the United States.Kansas City Star Magazine, 8/20/12, by Cindy Hoedel, “Mr. Mortgage: As James B. Nutter prospers, so does Kansas City,” http://www.equities.com/news/headline- story?dt=2012-08-17&val;=392347&cat;=finance Nutter was named 2012 Kansas Citian of the Year by the Greater Kansas City Chamber of Commerce.Greater Kansas City Chamber of Commerce release, http://www.kcchamber.com/Programs- Events/Awards/Kansas-Citian-of-the-Year-Award.aspx Nutter Sr. died in Kansas City on July 7, 2017 from stroke-related complications at the age of 89. ==References== Category:1928 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Deaths from stroke Category:Philanthropists from Missouri Category:Businesspeople from Kansas City, Missouri
title: James B. Nutter Sr.
